chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
Y: Type
X: Type
c: (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y
lc: X -> nat
Hc: forall (f : nat -> nat) (n : nat) (x : X), length (c f n x) = lc x
lnk: nat -> nat
i: nat
ll: list X
j: nat

Goal:
length (comp i ll j) = lsum ll

Premises:

VectorDef.of_list : forall l : list ?A, VectorDef.t ?A (length l) where ?A : [X : Type Y : Type c : (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y lc : X -> nat Hc : forall (f : nat -> nat) (n : nat) (x : X), length (c f n x) = lc x lnk : nat -> nat i : nat ll : list X j : nat |- Type]
VarMap.Branch : VarMap.t ?A -> ?A -> VarMap.t ?A -> VarMap.t ?A where ?A : [X : Type Y : Type c : (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y lc : X -> nat Hc : forall (f : nat -> nat) (n : nat) (x : X), length (c f n x) = lc x lnk : nat -> nat i : nat ll : list X j : nat |- Type]
link = fix link (i : nat) (ll : list X) (j : nat) {struct ll} : list (nat * nat) := match ll with | nil => nil | x :: ll0 => (i, j) :: link (S i) ll0 (lc x + j) end : nat -> list X -> nat -> list (nat * nat) Arguments link _%nat_scope _%list_scope _%nat_scope
FinFun.bInjective = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x y : nat, x < n -> y < n -> f x = f y -> x = y : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bInjective _%nat_scope _%function_scope
FinFun.bFun = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x : nat, x < n -> f x < n : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bFun _%nat_scope _%function_scope
FinFun.bSurjective = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall y : nat, y < n -> exists x : nat, x < n /\ f x = y : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bSurjective _%nat_scope _%function_scope
list_fun_inv : forall (X : Type) (l : list X), X -> {f : nat -> X | l = map f (list_an 0 (length l))}
list_repeat : forall X : Type, X -> nat -> list X
FinFun.bInjective_bSurjective : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), FinFun.bFun n f -> FinFun.bInjective n f < -> FinFun.bSurjective n f
list_split_length : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k <= length ll -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ length l = k}}
existsb_nth : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A) (n : nat) (d : A), n < length l -> existsb f l = false -> f (nth n l d) = false
list_pick : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k < length ll -> {x : X & {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ length l = k}}}
NoDup_nth : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (d : A), NoDup l < -> (forall i j : nat, i < length l -> j < length l -> nth i l d = nth j l d -> i = j)
NoDup_nth_error : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), NoDup l < -> (forall i j : nat, i < length l -> nth_error l i = nth_error l j -> i = j)
nth_default : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> nat -> A
nth : forall A : Type, nat -> list A -> A -> A
firstn : forall A : Type, nat -> list A -> list A
skipn : forall A : Type, nat -> list A -> list A
list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
seq = fix seq (start len : nat) {struct len} : list nat := match len with | 0 => nil | S len0 => start :: seq (S start) len0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments seq (_ _)%nat_scope
count_occ' : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> A -> nat
repeat : forall A : Type, A -> nat -> list A
length_compiler = fix length_compiler (lx : list X) : nat := match lx with | nil => 0 | x :: lx0 => lc x + length_compiler lx0 end : list X -> nat Arguments length_compiler _%list_scope
subcode_snoc_inv : forall (X : Type) (Q : code X) (i j : nat) (a l : list X), j = i + length l -> (i, l ++ a) <sc Q -> (j, a) <sc Q
nth_error : forall A : Type, list A -> nat -> option A
Permutation.Permutation_nth : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A) (d : A), l ~p l' < -> (let n := length l in length l' = n /\ (exists f : nat -> nat, FinFun.bFun n f /\ FinFun.bInjective n f /\ (forall x : nat, x < n -> nth x l' d = nth (f x) l d)))
partition_length : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l l1 l2 : list A), partition f l = (l1, l2) -> length l = length l1 + length l2
subcode_app_inv : forall (X : Type) (Q : code X) (i j : nat) (a l r : list X), j = i + length l -> (i, l ++ a ++ r) <sc Q -> (j, a) <sc Q
